text: Is there a usecase for nested classes?
I've recently seen several people doing things like this here on Stackoverflow:

code:
class A:
    foo = 1

    class B:
        def blah(self):
            pass

text: In other words, they have nested classes.

This works (although people new to Python seem to run into problems because it doesn't behave like they thought it would), but I can't think of any reason to do this in any language at all, and certainly not in Python.
Searching for this it seems it's reasonably common in C++, is there a good reason there?
